recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
2 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
instructions: In a bowl, mix cornstarch, flour, salt, and black pepper. Coat chicken pieces in the mixture.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken until golden brown and crispy. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add bell peppers and onion. Stir-fry for a few minutes until slightly tender.
Add pineapple chunks, ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, and water to the skillet. Stir well.
In a separate bowl, dissolve cornstarch in water. Add the cornstarch mixture to the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
Simmer for a few more minutes until the chicken is heated through and the flavors are well combined.
Serve the sweet and sour chicken over steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour the teriyaki marinade over them. Marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Remove the salmon from the marinade and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Reserve the marinade.
Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
Meanwhile, pour the reserved marinade into a small saucepan. In a separate bowl, mix cornstarch and water to make a slurry. Add the slurry to the saucepan.
Cook the marinade over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens into a glaze.
Once the salmon is cooked, brush the glaze over the fillets.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
Serve the teriyaki salmon with steamed rice or vegetables.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and diced tofu. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Push the tofu and garlic to one side of the wok, and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked through.
Add cooked rice noodles to the wok, along with bean sprouts, chopped green onions, and chopped roasted peanuts. Stir well to combine.
In a small bowl, mix together fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, lime juice, and red pepper flakes. Pour the sauce over the noodles and toss to coat.
Continue to stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, until everything is heated through and well combined.
Garnish with lime wedges and chopped cilantro.
Serve the Pad Thai hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1.5 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chicken chunks to the yogurt mixture and marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for another minute.
Add marinated chicken to the skillet, along with any remaining marinade. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.
Pour in the tomato sauce and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the flavors are well blended.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.
Serve the butter chicken with naan bread or steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Bulgogi
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, minced ginger, sliced green onions, and toasted sesame seeds.
Add the thinly sliced beef to the marinade and let it marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated beef to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, until browned and cooked through.
Remove the cooked beef from the skillet and serve on a platter.
Serve the bulgogi with lettuce leaves for wrapping and cooked rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Pho
instructions: In a large pot, bring the beef or chicken broth to a boil.
Add thinly sliced beef to the boiling broth and cook for 1-2 minutes, until cooked through. Remove the beef and set aside.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together fish sauce, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, grated ginger, minced garlic, ground cinnamon, and ground cloves.
Add the sauce mixture and thinly sliced onion to the pot of broth. Simmer for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Divide the cooked rice noodles among serving bowls. Top with the cooked beef slices.
Ladle the hot broth over the noodles and beef.
Garnish with bean sprouts, fresh basil leaves, fresh cilantro leaves, and sliced jalapenos.
Serve the pho with lime wedges on the side.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Nasi Lemak
ingredients: 1 pound chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
instructions: Rinse the jasmine rice and drain well.
In a pot, combine the rinsed rice, coconut milk, pandan leaf (if using), and salt. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
In a separate skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onion and minced garlic. Sauté until fragrant and golden brown.
Add curry powder to the skillet and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add chicken thighs to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through.
Stir in soy sauce and fish sauce. Cook for another 2 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend.
Remove the pandan leaf from the cooked rice and fluff the rice with a fork.
Serve the nasi lemak by placing a portion of rice on a plate. Top with the cooked chicken, sliced cucumber, fried anchovies, fried peanuts, and hard-boiled eggs.
Serve with sambal sauce on the side.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Adobo
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, whole black peppercorns, and bay leaves. Mix well.
Place chicken thighs in a large ziplock bag and pour the marinade over them. Seal the bag and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken thighs from the marinade, reserving the marinade.
Brown the chicken thighs in the hot oil for 2-3 minutes per side.
Pour the reserved marinade into the skillet with the chicken. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Remove the cooked chicken from the skillet and transfer to a serving platter.
Simmer the sauce in the skillet, uncovered, until it thickens slightly.
Pour the thickened sauce over the chicken.
Serve the adobo with cooked rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Gado-Gado
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as green beans, cabbage, carrots, and bean sprouts), blanched
instructions: Arrange the blanched mixed vegetables, fried tofu, fried tempeh, sliced hard-boiled eggs, and cooked rice on a serving platter.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, water, soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, minced garlic, and sambal oelek until smooth and well combined.
Pour the peanut sauce over the arranged vegetables and protein on the serving platter.
Serve gado-gado with lime wedges on the side.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Amok Trey
ingredients: 1 pound white fish fillets, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, combine fish sauce, sugar, curry powder, turmeric powder, and shrimp paste. Mix well to form a paste.
Add fish chunks to the paste and toss to coat. Let the fish marinate for 15-30 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat coconut milk and water over medium heat.
Add the marinated fish, kaffir lime leaves, and red chili to the saucepan. Stir gently to combine.
Simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors have melded together.
While the fish is cooking, prepare banana leaves by cutting them into rectangular pieces and blanching them in boiling water for a few seconds to soften.
Place a portion of the cooked fish and sauce onto each piece of banana leaf. Fold the leaf to form a packet, securing it with toothpicks if needed.
Steam the banana leaf packets for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to further develop and the banana leaves to impart their aroma.
Serve the amok trey while still hot, either in the banana leaf packets or transferred onto plates.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chicken cubes to the yogurt mixture and marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for another minute.
Add marinated chicken to the skillet, along with any remaining marinade. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.
Pour in the tomato sauce and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the flavors are well blended.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.
Serve the chicken tikka masala with naan bread or steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 1-2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Blend the spinach into a smooth puree using a blender or food processor.
In a large skillet, heat ghee over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for another minute.
Add ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Add the spinach puree to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Stir in the cubed paneer cheese and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Pour in the heavy cream and stir well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve the palak paneer with naan bread or steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Chana Masala
instructions: In a large skillet, heat ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for another minute.
Add diced tomatoes to the skillet, along with their juices. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, cayenne pepper, garam masala, and salt to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Add cooked chickpeas to the skillet and stir to coat them in the spice mixture.
Reduce heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.
Serve the chana masala with naan bread or steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Biryani
instructions: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

In a bowl, combine chicken pieces, yogurt, minced garlic, grated ginger, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, garam masala, and cayenne pepper. Mix well to coat the chicken in the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
In a large pot, heat ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken to the pot, along with any remaining marinade. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.
Add soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. Stir gently to combine with the chicken.

Add enough water to the pot to just cover the rice and chicken. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the flavors are well blended.
Stir in chopped fresh mint leaves, chopped fresh cilantro, fried onions,raisins, and sliced almonds. Season with salt to taste. Gently mix everything together.
Optional: Soak a few saffron strands in warm milk and drizzle it over the biryani for added fragrance and color.
Cover the pot and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve the biryani hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
instructions: Rinse the black lentils and red kidney beans under cold water. In a large bowl, soak them in water overnight.

Drain the soaked lentils and kidney beans. In a large pot, combine them with 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour, or until the lentils and beans are tender. Stir occasionally and add more water if needed.
In a separate skillet, heat ghee or butter over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet. Cook for another minute.
Add ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Add tomato puree to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the cooked lentils and beans to the skillet, along with any cooking liquid. Stir well to combine.
Stir in heavy cream and season with salt to taste. Simmer for another 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.
Serve the dal makhani with naan bread or steamed rice.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add minced garlic, chopped carrot, and chopped celery to the skillet. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add ground beef and ground pork to the skillet. Cook until browned, breaking up the meat with a spoon.
Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, red wine, dried oregano, and dried basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce heat to low and simmer the sauce for 20-30 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Serve the spaghetti topped with the Bolognese sauce.
Garnish with grated Parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
instructions: In a large Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the same Dutch oven, brown the chicken thighs and drumsticks on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add chopped onion, minced garlic, sliced mushrooms, and sliced carrots to the Dutch oven. Sauté until vegetables are tender.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir well to coat.
Pour in red wine, chicken broth, and tomato paste. Stir to combine.
Return the chicken and bacon to the Dutch oven. Add dried thyme and bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover the Dutch oven and simmer over low heat for 1.5-2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Discard the bay leaf before serving.
Serve the Coq au Vin hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Cheeseburger
instructions: Divide the ground beef into 4 equal portions. Shape each portion into a patty. Season with salt and pepper.
Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the burger patties for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar cheese on each patty and allow it to melt.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
Assemble the cheeseburgers by placing a patty on the bottom half of each bun.
Top with lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, sliced onions, and pickles.
Spread ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise on the top half of the buns.
Cover each patty with the top half of the bun to complete the cheeseburgers.
Serve the cheeseburgers hot.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Chicken Enchiladas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine shredded chicken, shredded cheddar cheese, diced onion, diced bell pepper, and diced green chilies. Mix well.
Pour half of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a baking dish.
In another bowl, mix sour cream and chopped cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Warm the flour tortillas in the microwave or on a skillet to make them more pliable.
Spread a spoonful of the sour cream mixture onto each tortilla.
Place a portion of the chicken mixture on top of the sour cream mixture on each tortilla. Roll up the tortillas and place them seam-side down in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through and the sauce is bubbly.
Garnish with sliced green onions, sliced black olives, and sliced jalapenos.
Serve the chicken enchiladas hot.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Moussaka
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the eggplant slices on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender.
In a large skillet, cook ground lamb over medium heat until browned. Remove any excess fat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet. Cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in diced tomatoes, dried oregano, ground cinnamon, and ground nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour in red wine and simmer the mixture for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
In a greased baking dish, layer half of the cooked eggplant slices on the bottom.
Spread half of the ground lamb mixture on top of the eggplant.
Sprinkle half of the grated Parmesan cheese over the lamb.
Repeat the layers with the remaining eggplant, lamb, and Parmesan cheese.
Pour the béchamel sauce evenly over the top layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and bubbly.
Let the moussaka cool for a few minutes before serving.
Serve the moussaka warm.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Paella
ingredients: 8 ounces chicken thighs, boneless and skinless, cut into chunks
1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large paella pan or skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until onion is translucent.
Add sliced red and green bell peppers to the pan. Cook until peppers are tender.
Add chicken chunks and sliced chorizo sausage to the pan. Cook until chicken is browned on all sides.
Stir in Arborio rice, smoked paprika, and saffron threads. Coat the rice with the oil and spices.
Pour in chicken broth and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is almost cooked.
Stir in frozen green peas and arrange shrimp, mussels, and clams on top of the rice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover the pan and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the seafood is cooked and the rice is fully cooked and slightly crispy on the bottom.
Remove from heat and let the paella rest for a few minutes before serving.
Serve the paella hot, garnished with lemon wedges and chopped fresh parsley.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Schnitzel
instructions: Place each pork chop between two sheets of plastic wrap. Use a meat mallet or rolling pin to pound the pork chops until they are about 1/4 inch thick.
Season the pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides.
Place the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs in separate shallow dishes.
Dredge each pork chop in flour, shaking off any excess. Dip it into the beaten eggs, then coat it with breadcrumbs, pressing lightly to adhere.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the breaded pork chops to the skillet. Cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove the cooked schnitzel from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
Serve the schnitzel hot, garnished with lemon slices and chopped fresh parsley.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Fish and Chips
ingredients: 4 white fish fillets (such as cod or haddock)
4 large potatoes, cut into thick fries
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add cold water, stirring until the batter is smooth and thick.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F (190°C).
Dip each fish fillet into the batter, coating it evenly.
Carefully lower the battered fish fillets into the hot oil. Fry for about 4-5 minutes, or until the fish is golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.
In the same hot oil, fry the cut potatoes in batches until they are golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Season the fish and chips with salt and vinegar to taste.
Serve the fish and chips hot, with tartar sauce on the side.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Swedish Meatballs
instructions: In a bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, breadcrumbs, milk, chopped onion, egg, ground allspice, ground nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into small meatballs,about 1 inch in diameter.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the meatballs and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through. Remove the meatballs from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, sprinkle flour and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Gradually whisk in beef broth, heavy cream, and Worcestershire sauce. Cook until the sauce thickens.
Return the meatballs to the skillet and simmer in the sauce for a few minutes to heat through.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve the Swedish meatballs hot, either as an appetizer or over mashed potatoes or egg noodles as a main dish.
Enjoy!

recipes.name: Lamb Rack
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, combine minced garlic, chopped fresh rosemary, Dijon mustard, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Rub the mixture all over the racks of lamb, coating them evenly.
Heat a large oven-safe skillet over high heat. Place the racks of lamb in the skillet, fat side down, and sear for about 2 minutes.
Flip the racks of lamb and transfer the skillet to the preheated oven.
Roast the lamb racks in the oven for 12-15 minutes, or until desired doneness (medium-rare is recommended).
Remove the skillet from the oven and let the lamb racks rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Serve the lamb racks hot, with mint jelly on the side.
Enjoy!
